thread.title: Funniest tweets about The Oscars’ Steve Harvey moment
thread.title_full: Funniest tweets about The Oscars’ Steve Harvey moment

author: ppastor
title: Funniest tweets about The Oscars’ Steve Harvey moment
text:
By: Pam Pastor - Super and 2BU Editor / @pajammy 01:48   
Warren Beatty and Faye Dunaway pulled a Steve Harvey at the Oscars, announcing “La La Land” as the Best Picture winner instead of “Moonlight” which actually bagged the prize. 
“Warren, what did you do?!” host Jimmy Kimmel said. 
But it wasn’t actually their fault. (And neither was it Steve Harvey’s). Someone handed them the wrong envelope. Beatty explained on the Oscar stage, “I want to tell you what happened. I opened the envelope and it said “Emma Stone La La Land.” That’s why I took such a long look at Faye (Dunaway)… I wasn’t trying to be funny.” ADVERTISEMENT 
But it was kind of funny. And really really awkward. And we couldn’t help but feel bad for the cast and crew of La La Land who were in the middle of giving really good speeches when they were cut short. 
Twitter exploded with reactions to the mess. Here are the funniest ones.
